text:
Statement 1: An application for compulsory license under Section 84 can be made at any time after the grant of the patent.
 
  Statement 2:
 
An application for compulsory license under Section 84 can be made by any interested person.

Statement 1: The patent application shall be ordinarily open to the public after a period of 18 months from the date of filing the application

 
  Statement 2: The applicant shall be entitled to file a suit for infringement after the publication of the patent application
How many types of compulsory licenses are provided for under the Indian patent Act-

Compulsory License for export under Indian Patents Act is for--
options: Diagnostic kits required for their use

text: India follows which of the following rules in relation to patent rights?
The appropriate court for initiating a suit for patent infringement is-
Post grant opposition can be filed by—
options: Only by the Central government in public interest

text: The publication of an application shall be available
options: Official Journal of the Patent office
Official Gazette of the Government of India
Website of the Press Information Bureau
